Hainan EV Road Trip Guide | Generated by AI

Home 2025.10

Trip Overview

Your 5-day trip (July 11, 7pm to July 17, 12pm) starts and ends in Guangzhou, focusing on Hainan Province (Haikou, Sanya, and Dongfang). Since you’re taking your Neta EV car, you’ll drive to Hai’an New Port (near Xuwen) for the ferry to Haikou’s Xiuying Port, as EVs are restricted from using the older Xuwen Port (rule effective since March 20, 2025). The return will follow the same route. Total driving distance round-trip: ~1,060 km (excluding island driving). Island loop: ~920 km.

Key considerations:

  • EV-Specific: Hainan is EV-friendly with 14+ charging stations along the coastal highway (G98) and dense networks in Haikou and Sanya (e.g., via apps like Tesla Supercharger or State Grid). Plan charges every 200-300 km; your Neta’s range should handle it. No specific battery charge limits for the ferry, but ensure <80% SOC for safety. Book ferry spots early as EVs may be limited during peaks (though July is off-peak).
  • Ferry Booking: Use WeChat mini-programs like “Qiongzhou Strait Ferry Manager” or “Hai’an Xin Port” for real-name booking (ID required). Book outbound/inbound at least 1-2 days ahead. Cost per leg: ~¥375 (car) + ¥41.5/person (passenger) + ¥30 (insurance) = ~¥446.5 for solo driver. Journey: 1.5 hours. Ferries run ~every 3 hours, 24/7.
  • General Tips: Drive safely (highways toll ~¥200-300 round-trip). Pack ID/passport, car docs, charger cable, snacks/water. Check weather (tropical, rainy July). Book hotels with EV charging. Total estimated cost (excluding food/hotels): ¥1,500-2,000 (ferries + tolls + fuel equiv.).
  • Driving Times: Based on highways; add 30-60 min for traffic/rest stops.

Day-by-Day Itinerary

Day 1: July 11 (Guangzhou to Hai’an New Port) – Travel Day

  • 7:00 PM: Depart Guangzhou via G15 Shen-Hai Expressway south toward Zhanjiang/Xuwen (530 km, ~5.5 hours driving).
  • ~12:30 AM (July 12): Arrive Hai’an New Port area. If tired, overnight at a nearby hotel (e.g., in Xuwen; many have EV charging). Check for late-night ferries (e.g., 1-3 AM departures).
  • What to Take Care Of: Avoid night driving fatigue – stop at rest areas. Pre-book ferry if aiming for an overnight crossing. Charge EV fully in Guangzhou.

Day 2: July 12 (Ferry to Haikou + Explore Haikou)

  • Early Morning (e.g., 2:00 AM if overnight drive, or 7-9 AM if rested): Board ferry at Hai’an New Port (arrive 1 hour early for security/ticket check). Ferry to Xiuying Port, Haikou (~1.5 hours).
  • ~3:30 AM (or 8:30-10:30 AM): Arrive Haikou. Drive to city center (~20 min). Check into hotel (e.g., near Qilou Old Street; recommend EV-friendly like Hilton Haikou).
  • Morning/Afternoon: Rest, then explore Haikou. Visit Qilou Old Street (arcaded architecture, street food/snacks like coconut rice). Afternoon: Hainan Tropical Wildlife Park (pandas, tropical animals; 30 min drive north).
  • Evening: Dinner at local seafood spots. Overnight in Haikou.
  • Driving: Minimal (~50 km). Charge EV at hotel/port.
  • What to Take Care Of: On ferry, park car on deck 1; you move to passenger area (no staying in car). Verify ferry schedule day-of via app.

Day 3: July 13 (Haikou to Sanya)

  • Morning: Quick visit to Haikou Volcano Crater Park (hiking, views; 30 min drive south).
  • ~10:00 AM: Drive to Sanya via G98 East Line (~300 km, 3-4 hours; scenic coastal views).
  • ~2:00 PM: Arrive Sanya. Check into beach hotel (e.g., Atlantis Sanya; EV charging available).
  • Afternoon/Evening: Relax at Yalong Bay (white sands, swimming). Stroll Sanya Bay for sunset.
  • Overnight: Sanya.
  • Driving: 300 km. Stop for charge in Lingshui (~midway; public stations).
  • What to Take Care Of: Highway speed limits (100-120 km/h). Hydrate – hot/humid.

Day 4: July 14 (Sanya to Dongfang)

  • Morning: More Sanya – visit Tianya Haijiao (“End of the Earth” rocks, romantic spot).
  • ~11:00 AM: Drive to Dongfang via G98 West Line (~200 km, ~2.5 hours; rural views).
  • ~1:30 PM: Arrive Dongfang. Explore Hainan Railway Museum (retro trains, history) or Dongfang Natural Treasures Park (beaches, mangroves).
  • Afternoon/Evening: Beach time or local markets. Overnight in Dongfang (limited options; try City Comfort Inn with potential charging).
  • Driving: 200 km. Charge in Ledong (~midway).
  • What to Take Care Of: Dongfang is less touristy – fewer EV spots; charge fully in Sanya.

Day 5: July 15 (Dongfang to Haikou)

  • Morning: More Dongfang if needed (e.g., coastal walks).
  • ~10:00 AM: Drive back to Haikou via G98 (~220 km, ~2.5 hours).
  • ~12:30 PM: Arrive Haikou. Afternoon free: Visit Hainan Museum (culture/history) or shop.
  • Evening: Dinner, prepare for return. Overnight in Haikou near Xiuying Port.
  • Driving: 220 km. Charge upon arrival.
  • What to Take Care Of: Book return ferry for early July 17 (e.g., 4-5 AM departure).

Return: July 16-17 (Haikou to Guangzhou)

  • July 16 Evening: Relax in Haikou or drive to port if early ferry.
  • Early July 17 (e.g., 4:00 AM): Board ferry at Xiuying Port to Hai’an New Port (~1.5 hours).
  • ~5:30 AM: Arrive mainland. Drive north to Guangzhou (~530 km, 5.5 hours).
  • ~11:00 AM: Arrive Guangzhou (buffer for stops).
  • By 12:00 PM: Trip ends.
  • Driving: 530 km. Charge at port/highway stops.
  • What to Take Care Of: Early ferry to meet deadline. Confirm no delays (weather can affect ferries).
